titles.title: Mäṣḥafä gәbrä ḥǝmamat “Book of the Rite of the Holy Week”

shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Mäṣḥafä gәbrä ḥǝmamat “Book of the Rite of the Holy Week” (fols. 2ra-248va) I-1) Introduction (fols. 2ra-4vb) I-2) Eve of Palm Sunday (fols. 4vb-7vb) I-3) Palm Sunday (fols. 8ra-18rb) I-4) Monday (fols. 18rb-46vb) - Night hours (fols. 18rb-23va) - Day hours (fols. 23va-46vb) I-5) Tuesday (fols. 46vb-70ra) - Night hours (fols. 46vb-51ra) - Day hours (fols. 51ra-70ra) I-6) Wednesday (fols. 70ra-87rb) - Night hours (fols. 70ra-73rb) - Day hours (fols. 73rb-87rb) I-7) Thursday (fols. 87rb-114vb) - Night hours (fols. 87rb-91rb) - Day hours (fols. 91rb-114vb) I-8) Friday (fols. 115ra-180va) - Night hours (fols. 115ra-130ra) - Day hours (fols. 130ra-180va), including: Homily by Jacob of Serug on Abraham (fols. 148vb-155va) I-9) Saturday (fols. 180va-205rb) - Night hours (fols. 180va-196va) - Mass (fols. 196va-205rb), including: Tǝmhǝrtä ḫǝbuʾat “Teaching of Mysteries” (fols. 203vb-205rb) I-10) Mäṣḥafä dorho “Book of the Cock” (fols. 205va-219ra) I-11) Homilies on Passion of Christ - Homily by Ephrem on Passion of Our Lord and on the thief on the right hand (fols. 219ra-222rb) - Homily by Cyriacus of Behnesa [Laḥa Maryam “Lamentation of Mary”] (fols. 222rb-248va).

donors.donor: Gäbrä Mäsqäl is mentioned in most of the supplication formulas of the text (e.g., fols. 8rb, 8va, 17ra, 67vb), usually with "his lady and beloved" (ʾǝgzǝʾtu wä-fǝqǝrtu) Wälättä Qǝddusan. On fols. 2ra and 5rb, her name occurs together with those of King ʾIyasu, Queen Wälättä Giyorgis and ras Wäldä Lǝʿul, all of them mentioned as her children; later in the text she is mentioned, more specifically, as the mother of Queen Wälättä Giyorgis (esp. fols. 156ra, 165vab) and of ras Wäldä Lǝʿul (esp. fol. 156rb).

dcomments.dcomment: 1733-1755 (?). In the supplication formula of fol. 2ra (incipit page of Text I-1) and fol. 5rb are mentioned ʾIyasu as king, Wälättä Giyorgis as queen, and Wäldä Lǝʿul as ras. On fol. 109rb, is mentioned only King ʾIyasu together with Queen Wälättä Giyorgis. ʾIyasu II was King of Ethiopia in 1730-55 (cp. EAE III, 251-52); Wälättä Giyorgis is the baptismal name of Bǝrhan Mogäsa (known as Mǝntǝwwab; cp. EAE I, 534-35 and also EAE III, 251-52), mother of ʾIyasu II, who ruled with him. Ras Wäldä Lǝʿul (d. 1767; about him cp. EAE IV, 1104) was the brother of Wälättä Giyorgis. He received the title of ras in 1733. Quires XXII-XXIX are probably of a later time.

txstates.txstate: Bottom corners of fols. 1-35 are cut. Cuts repaired, e.g., on fols. 189, 202, 211, 223, 233. Small holes, e.g., on fols. 176, 179, 191, 202, 235. A few fols. are worn and affected by humidy (e.g., fols. 182r, 182v, 187v, 241r).

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with tooled reddish-brown leather (partly torn off on the spine); textile inlays (one on the back board is missing). Two pairs of sewing stations. Two pairs of chains of endband stitches through the spine cover.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 5 tools were used: double sine wave with dots, double line fillet, fourfold line fillet, double circle, cross hatching).

squires.squire:
A(1; s.l.: 1, stub before 1/fol. 1rv) – ፩I(8/fols. 2r-9v) – ፪II(8/fols. 10r-17v) – ፫III(8/fols. 18r-25v) – ፬IV(8/fols. 26r-33v) – ፭V(8/fols. 34r-41v) – ፯VI(8/fols. 42r-49v) – ፯VII(8/fols. 50r-57v) – ፰VIII(8/fols. 58r-65v) – ፱IX(8/fols. 66r-73v) – ፲X(8/fols. 74r-81v) – ፲፩XI(8/fols. 82r-89v) – ፲፪XII(8/fols. 90r-97v) – ፲፫XIII(8/fols. 98r-105v) – ፲፬XIV(8/fols. 106r-113v) – ፲፭XV(8/fols. 114r-121v) – ፲፯XVI(8/fols. 122r-129v) – ፲፯XVII(8/fols. 130r-137v) – ፲፰XVIII(8/fols. 138r-145v) – ፲፱XIX(8/fols. 146r-153v) – ፳XX(8/fols. 154r-161v) – ፳፩XXI(8/fols. 162r-169v) – <XXII(10; s.l.: 1, stub after 10; 10, stub after 1/fols. 170r-179v) – XXIII(10/fols. 180r-189v) – XXIV(10/fols. 190r-199v) – XXV(10/fols. 200r-209v) – XXVI(10/fols. 210r-119v) – XXVII(10/fols. 220r-229v) – XXVIII(9; s.l.: 7, stub after 2/fols. 230r-238v) – XXIX(10/fols. 239r-248v)>.
Probably quires XXII-XXIX were added later.

taunit.mr-info: Quires A-XXI. All data are fol. 3r.
taunit.rl-info:
Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling (a few times also below, e.g., in fols. 200rb, 200v, 201r, 203v, 204v).
One or two ruled lines were not used by the scribe at the bottom of some fols. (e.g., fols. 56r-v, 180r-v, 181rb, 181va, 182v, 183vb, 190rb, 196rv). Fols. 133r-134v have additional ruled lines in the bottom margin.

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: fine. Hand b: mediocre, irregular.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a: fols. 2ra-169vb, characterized by broad, tall, rounded and slightly right-sloping letters. - The 6th order marker of ጰ is set up on a vertical stroke and oriented to the left (e.g., fols. 5ra l.12, 159vb l.14). - The 6th order marker of the letter ሠ is very pronounced and extended on the left (e.g., fols. 12r l.19, 21ra l.21). - X-cross with dashes is used several times (e.g., fols. 2rb, 47va, 58rb). - The number ፮ usually looks like a "compressed" ፯. This is visible in the quire marks (s. “varia”) and in the readings of the 6th hour. Hand b: fols. 170ra-248va, characterized by an irregular handwriting, with changing quality (cp., e.g., fols. 199v and 200r, 220r and 220v). - The letter ገ in the 6th order shows a rounded top with the loop marker triangular and flat (e.g., fol. 195vb, ls. 4, 5, 6); - the words እግዚአብሔር፡ and እግዚእ፡ are usually written with ligature.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; the names of the donors and their relatives (ʾIyasu, Wälättä Giyorgis, Wäldä Lǝʿul). A few lines (4-7) alternating with black lines in the incipit page of Texts I-1 and I-8, in the incipit page of the section for the day hours of Friday (in Text I-8), and in the incipit of Text I-12; headings and incipits of the texts, their sections and subsections; titles of the Biblical books and other works; directives for the ministers in Texts I-7 and I-9; names of Hebrew letters in Text I-8; the initial words of each paragraph of “Tǝmḫǝrtä ḫǝbuʾat” (in Text I-9); the words: ʿƎgziʾo täśähalännä in Text I-7, and ṣällǝyu bä-ʾǝntä (and abbreviation for ṣällǝyu) in Text I-12; some interlineal corrections (e.g., fols. 217ra, ls. 8 and 13, 244vb l.2). Elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals or their elements; elements of the text dividers.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ለዓ፡ ዓለ፡ አሜ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fols. 205va l.4, 243ra l.28) አሜ፡ for አሜን፡ (e.g., fol. 222rb l.23) ጸል፡ for ጸልዩ፡ (e.g., fol. 232vb l.22)

otherdetails.otherdetail: - Compressed script used in several portions of the text, especially on fols. 170ra-148va (quires XXII- XXIX): e.g., fols. 181ra, 191va, 191vb, 197va, 205rb.

extras.extra:
- Excerpts from hymns for the Good Friday (?) added (in black or red ink; encircled by lines) in the upper margins of fols. 138v, 139r, 139v, 147r, 147v, 161v, 162r, 162v, 169r.
- Notes (in black and red, encircled by lines or dots) written in the margins or inside the text: ʾAdam: fol. 193r wä-śännay: fol. 193r nahu śännay: fol. 193v zä-yǝtnäbbäb ʾǝm-dǝḫrä raʿǝyä Yoḥannǝs: fol. 196r bä-6th säʿat ʾǝm-ʿǝlätä ʿarb: fol. 214vb (inside the text) mäṣḥafä dorho: fol. 205v gäb wah (?) (repeated twice): fol. 213v zä-sänuy tǝnśaʾe mǝnbab: fol. 233v zä-ḥamus: fol. 239va (inside the text).
Only in quires XXII-XXIX (fols. 170ra-148va) - several corrections (omissions or additions) written interlineally: e.g., fols. 176va, 177ra, 177vb, 193va, 195ra; - several erasures: e.g., fols. 174rb, 199ra, 201rb, 204rb; - a few immediate corrections marked by thin lines above and below the word: e.g., fols. 182va, 228va; - in a few words each letter, or each two letters, is followed by one nine dot asterisk: e.g., ዘሠ፨ ሉስ፨ (fol. 236va), ዘረ፨ ቡ፨ ዕ፨ (fol. 238va), አ፨ ሜ፨ ን፨ (fol. 248va).
- Crude notes or doodles by recent hands, in pen and pencil, in the margins and inside the text: e.g., fols. 72r, 93v, 117v, 172r, 211r, 214v, 248v.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Quire marks (in black ink) are written in the upper left margin of the first fol. of quires A-XXI: ፩: fol. 2r; ፪: fol. 10r; ፫: fol. 18r; ፬: fol. 26r; ፭: fol. 34r; ፮: fol. 42r; ፯: fol. 50r; ፰: fol. 58r; ፱: fol. 66r; ፲: fol. 74r; ፲፩: fol. 82r; ፲፪: fol. 90r; ፲፫፡: fol. 98r; ፲፬፡: fol. 106r; ፲፭፡: fol. 114r; ፲፮ ፡: fol. 122r; ፲፯፡: fol. 130r; ፲፰፡: fol. 138r; ፲፱፡: fol. 146r; ፳፡: fol. 154r; ፳፩፡: fol. 162r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: Thread inserted in the upper part of fols. 209r, 215r, 232r.
